Siow NanLevel 6. MasterAnswered on 22 May 2019Yes you lose out if you do so. Why? 1) you lose on exchange fees when your funds in Usd is converted to sgd for your withdrawal.. Then when you deposit back you lose on exchange fees from sgd to usd. You might be better off investing in forex if you can time and withdrawal and deposit right. 2) if you withdraw your "earnings" in the short term, then you are defeating the purpose of compound effect of having your earnings reinvested for longer term gains. This is a long term savings plan and if you notice the predicted chart for your portfolio, the bulk of the gains will be at the latter years where your gains over the years are compounded to greater effect.0 comments2
